metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12430 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in qemuDomainGetStatsIOThread in qemu/qemu_driver.c in libvirt 4.10.0 though 6.x before 6.1.0. A memory leak was found in the virDomainListGetStats libvirt API that is responsible for retrieving domain statistics when managing QEMU guests. This flaw allows unprivileged users with a read-only connection to cause a memory leak in the domstats command, resulting in a potential denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-clients - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-sanlock - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt-wireshark - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
libvirt0 - 6.0.0-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-0ubuntu6').
